metadata.title: CVE-2020-3702 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
u'Specifically timed and handcrafted traffic can cause internal errors in aWLAN device that lead to improper layer 2 Wi-Fi encryption with aconsequent possibility of information disclosure over the air for adiscrete set of traffic' in Snapdragon Auto, Snapdragon Compute, SnapdragonConnectivity, Snapdragon Consumer IOT, Snapdragon Industrial IOT,Snapdragon Mobile, Snapdragon Voice & Music, Snapdragon Wearables,Snapdragon Wired Infrastructure and Networking in APQ8053, IPQ4019,IPQ8064, MSM8909W, MSM8996AU, QCA9531, QCN5502, QCS405, SDX20, SM6150,SM7150

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-3702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
